citations.narrative:
* Official USDA form (7019) animals on hand other than dogs or cats were incomplete. The following animals were
missing from the 7019 form, one Camel, three Water Buffalo, two American Bison, one Watusi and two Coatimundi. When
the records and animals currently at the facility do not match it makes the records incomplete. Complete and accurate
records are needed to ensure each animal’s identity can be known with certainty, track the movement of animals and to
facilitate the inspection process. The licensee must maintain complete and accurate records of all animals at the facility.
The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information
concerning animals other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his
or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that
dealer. Correct by 10/28/23.

* Cobwebs and dust were observed accumulating on top of the sheltered housing and the interior wall area next to the
sheltered housing in the Kangaroo and Wallaby enclosure building housing five Kangaroos and five Wallaby's. In addition,
cobwebs and dust were observed accumulating on the fencing in one enclosure housing one Chocoan Cavy. This
indicates a living area exists for insects. Potential unsanitary living conditions and health issues exist if the affected areas
are not kept clean. The licensee must ensure a safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and
avian and mammalian pests shall be established and maintained. Correct by 10/12/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
* Official USDA form (7019) animals on hand other than dogs or cats were incomplete. The following animals were 
missing from the 7019 form, one Camel, three Water Buffalo, two American Bison, one Watusi and two Coatimundi. When 
the records and animals currently at the facility do not match it makes the records incomplete. Complete and accurate 
records are needed to ensure each animal’s identity can be known with certainty, track the movement of animals and to 
facilitate the inspection process. The licensee must maintain complete and accurate records of all animals at the facility. 
The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information 
concerning animals other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his 
or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that 
dealer. Correct by 10/28/23. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
* Cobwebs and dust were observed accumulating on top of the sheltered housing and the interior wall area next to the 
sheltered housing in the Kangaroo and Wallaby enclosure building housing five Kangaroos and five Wallaby's. In addition, 
cobwebs and dust were observed accumulating on the fencing in one enclosure housing one Chocoan Cavy. This 
indicates a living area exists for insects. Potential unsanitary living conditions and health issues exist if the affected areas 
are not kept clean. The licensee must ensure a safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and 
avian and mammalian pests shall be established and maintained. Correct by 10/12/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
